title: After 15 years of failed attempts, there will finally be a Gears of War movie
description: Netflix moves forward with a live-action film, animated series, and maybe more.

title: Hacker took pains to hide $3.36B of stolen bitcoin. Feds found it anyway
description: The haul, the second biggest in DOJ history, shows the difficulty of hiding cryptocurrency.

title: Oculus co-founder makes a VR headset that can literally kill you
description: Sword Art Online inspires Palmer Luckey to put explosive charges on a Quest Pro.

title: Carnival Row announces second and final season with briefest of teasers
description: Travis Beacham's "Victorian neo-noir" fantasy series debuted in 2019.

title: New Go-playing trick defeats world-class Go AI—but loses to human amateurs
description: Adversarial policy attacks blind spots in the AI—with broader implications than games.

title: Benoit Blanc disses Clue as a “terrible game” in final trailer for Glass Onion
description: "Ticking boxes, running around, searching all the rooms...."

title: Musk announces Twitter ban on unlabeled parody after celebs impersonate him
description: Famous people trolled Musk by tweeting under his name and profile picture.

title: Chinese chip designers slow down processors to dodge US sanctions
description: Cutting-edge semiconductor companies tweak specs to comply with export controls.

title: Musk-led Twitter laid off some employees by mistake, asks them to come back
description: Dozens of canned workers asked back after Twitter realizes they're still needed.

title: Megalodon, extinct giant shark, started life in nurseries
description: The largest sharks ever seem to have left their young in an unsupervised daycare.
